text.text:
Stayed there for 2 nights. In the beginning I couldn't find towels, went to the reception and took some, but they were full of stains.
There was an awful smell coming from the bathroom. One day we didn't have water at all.
Only 2 small bottles of drinking water.
No soap or shampoo in the bathroom either.
The paint on the walls started to peel off.
Very noisy in the night. Doors being slammed constantly.
Bad view from the window- trash scattered on the ground.
Good internet connection.
Overall, I wouldn't recommend it.

text.text: The Malay man staff is not professional in arranged a room, the room with no towels provided, suggests the owner of hotel not simply to take a person as a counter staff,  hv to monitor them. Not recommend this hotel.

originalText.text: The Malay man staff is not professional in arranged a room, the room with no towels provided, suggests the owner of hotel not simply to take a person as a counter staff,  hv to monitor them. Not recommend this hotel.

text.text:
The condition of the room was terrible. The wallpaper was peeling off, and the ceiling in the bathroom was broken. The bed sheets were stained, and to make matters worse, there were lizard feces on the pillow. When we asked the staff to change the bed sheets, they informed us that the housekeeping staff was not available, leaving us no choice but to sleep with the dirty and stained sheets throughout the night.

In addition to these issues, the room had extremely thin walls. Every time a car drove by outside, the noise was amplified and made it uncomfortably loud inside the room. We were constantly disturbed by the traffic noise, adding to our already unpleasant experience. Also, there are no hair dryer. The TV channel sometimes work and sometimes not.

We stayed in that room for three nights, and each day we were disturbed by the adjacent store undergoing renovations, creating an unbearable amount of noise. After a tiring day outside, it was impossible to get any sleep due to the constant noise. Additionally, the room had thin curtains, allowing too much brightness to enter during the day, making it impossible to rest properly regardless of how tired we were. Overall, our experience was extremely unpleasant.

text.text: An ok budget hotel.  Even though the room I had was small but it's was clean & comfortable enough. It's also have a small balcony with a good view of the city, depending of the room type . This hotel doesn't have a lift so be mindfull if you want to choose rooms on higher floor. There's  a mamak stall next to the hotel & you can ordered your food & they sent to your room too.

There's  a mamak stall next to the hotel & you can ordered your food & they sent to your room too.

text.text: We (2 adults and 1 9-year-old kid) stayed at the Family Room for 1 night. The room is spacious and clean. Shower is working well with very strong water pressure. Overall is satisfying except the air-condition is not so cool and WiFi connection isn't stable.

text.text: Stayed 1 night in family room (1 King bed + 1 single bed).. Rm109 last minute booking. Spacious room/toilet.. Clean..Basic amenities provided. Building is well maintained. Strategic location. There is restaurant available beside the lobby (The best roti canai sardines ever).. Very recommended - Both hotel & restaurant ;)

text.text: The price is very reasonable and worth staying with couples or family. The room was clean and big enough to perform solat conveniencely. The bathroom is big and clean.

text.text: Good bargains for a budget hotel. We stayed for a night with RM100 for Triple room (1 king bed + 1 single bed) and RM80 for Standard room (1 queen/king bed), can check it out at their website. All provided facilities are working fine, airconditioner, television, iron, bathroom, parking also provided for guests. Staff at front desk is friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean eventhough this hotel was like an old one (compared to few other modern hotels).

Rooms are clean eventhough this hotel was like an old one (compared to few other modern hotels).

text.text: Reasonably clean. The triple bed room is big and spacious. Furniture and fittings are outdated and worn out. However, hotel is located close to fast food joints and local eateries. There is a supermarket nearby too. Friendly receptionist.

text.text: Visited my relative in Bera during Thaipusam Holiday on 26/2/2024 and stayed at this hotel. Very convenient location, mamak restaurant just next door it is super easy to get our comfort food. Very Good & affordable price for cheap hotel you can find in Bera. Room is super clean. Their staff are very friendly even the owner greet us well upon our arrival. Recommended hotel if you look for cheap and easy access hotel in Bera.

text.text: Really bad experience. Booked this hotel via oyo website but on the day that I booked, the receptionist said they do not accept any online bookings and my booking was not even in their record. They even told us they have not used OYO for the longest time and now OYO is under scammer? They should have just removed their hotel from the OYO website to avoid this from happening again.

text.text:
Overall, the experience was ok. The homestay is in the heart of Bera.
Well equipped , all rooms have aircond, except the family hall.  However, the kitchen tools are a bit old and the remotes for aircond sometimes having problem.
The owner is friendly and nice.
Ps..nothing much to do in Bera. The nearest town is Triang about 10mins drive.

text.text:
Had the one of the best trip this year! It's a small town and everything is accessible within 10mins drive. Host is friendly and helpful. Place is clean and comfortable. Highly recommended! Best part, they are pet friendly! Can't wait to return for a 2nd vacay here.

IG: wong_kopitiam
